Parallelize a function

Source: R/parallelize_fun.R
parallelize_fun.Rd

Parallelize a function

Usage

parallelize_fun(
  x,
  fun,
  cores = 1,
  export_fun = NULL,
  clean_result = FALSE,
  throw_error = TRUE,
  timestamp_format = paste0("[", format(Sys.time(), "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"), "] "),
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

x

A vector or list to apply over.

fun

The function to be applied to each element.

cores

The number of cores to use for parallelization with foreach::foreach. Default is 1.

export_fun

The functions to export the function to workers.

clean_result

Whether to remove failed results from output. If FALSE, failed results are kept as error objects. Default is FALSE.

throw_error

Whether to print detailed error information for failed results. Default is TRUE.

timestamp_format

Format string for timestamp display. Default is "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S".

verbose

Whether to print the message. Default is TRUE.

Value

A list of computed results. If clean_result = FALSE, failed results are included as error objects. If clean_result = TRUE, only successful results are returned.

Examples

parallelize_fun(1:3, function(x) {
  Sys.sleep(0.2)
  x^2
})
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:50] Using 1 core
#> ⠙ [2025-11-17 12:07:50] Running [1/3] Processing: 1  ETA:  0s
#> ✔ [2025-11-17 12:07:50] Completed 3 tasks in 623ms
#> 
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:50] Building results
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $`3`
#> [1] 9
#> 

parallelize_fun(list(1, 2, 3), function(x) {
  Sys.sleep(0.2)
  x^2
}, cores = 2)
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:51] Using 2 cores
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:51] Building results
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> $`3`
#> [1] 4
#> 

# Examples with error handling
parallelize_fun(1:5, function(x) {
  if (x == 3) stop("Error on element 3")
  x^2
}, clean_result = FALSE)
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Using 1 core
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Building results
#> ! [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Found 1 failed result
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] ✖ Error details:
#> ℹ                       ✖ "3": Error on element 3
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $`3`
#> $error
#> [1] "Error on element 3"
#> 
#> $index
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $input
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "parallelize_error"
#> 
#> $`4`
#> [1] 16
#> 
#> $`5`
#> [1] 25
#> 

parallelize_fun(1:5, function(x) {
  if (x == 3) stop("Error on element 3")
  x^2
}, clean_result = TRUE)
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Using 1 core
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Building results
#> ! [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Found 1 failed result
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] ✖ Error details:
#> ℹ                       ✖ "3": Error on element 3
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Removed 1 failed result
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $`4`
#> [1] 16
#> 
#> $`5`
#> [1] 25
#> 

# Control error printing
parallelize_fun(1:5, function(x) {
  if (x == 2) stop("Error on element 3")
  if (x == 4) stop("Error on element 4")
  x^2
})
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Using 1 core
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Building results
#> ! [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Found 2 failed results
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] ✖ Error details:
#> ℹ                       ✖ "2": Error on element 3
#> ℹ                       ✖ "4": Error on element 4
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> $error
#> [1] "Error on element 3"
#> 
#> $index
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $input
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "parallelize_error"
#> 
#> $`3`
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> $`4`
#> $error
#> [1] "Error on element 4"
#> 
#> $index
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $input
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "parallelize_error"
#> 
#> $`5`
#> [1] 25
#> 

parallelize_fun(1:5, function(x) {
  if (x == 3) stop("Error on element 3")
  x^2
}, throw_error = FALSE)
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Using 1 core
#> ℹ [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Building results
#> ! [2025-11-17 12:07:52] Found 1 failed result
#> $`1`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`2`
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $`3`
#> $error
#> [1] "Error on element 3"
#> 
#> $index
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $input
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "parallelize_error"
#> 
#> $`4`
#> [1] 16
#> 
#> $`5`
#> [1] 25
#>
